result.execSummary:
Dominick John Tardive was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Dominick John Tardive was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominick John Tardive

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on February 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:45 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Michelle P Brekken  DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson for today   DF:  Dominick John Tardive appeared from jail. Court advises of rights. Atty Harrelson states DE would like to waive extradition to return to Washington County, MN. S/T Defendant. Court questions Defendant. Defendant executes Waiver of Extradition. Court finds Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to extradition hearing to be returned to Washington County, MN. Court sets BBH in the event DE is not picked up by Washington County, MN. Adjourned at 1:49 PM.  gll  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Extradition Attachments- Washington County, MN.  gll
